title: Support dual monitor workflow
Add footnotes option to final document (הערות שוליים)
description:
## Footnotes Feature

### User Flow:
1. User clicks 'Start Editing' (כניסה למצב עריכה) to enter edit mode
2. User places cursor where they want the footnote reference
3. User clicks 'Add Footnote' button
4. Dialog opens asking for footnote content
5. On approve:
   - System checks existing footnotes on current page
   - Assigns next sequential number (per-page numbering, resets each page)
   - Inserts superscript number at cursor position
   - Adds footnote content at bottom of page with separator line

### Requirements:
- Footnote numbering: Per-page (resets to 1 on each new page)
- Footnote placement: Bottom of page with separator line
- Edit/Delete: User can edit or delete existing footnotes
- Export support: Both PDF and DOCX exports must include footnotes
close_reason: Core footnotes feature implemented: add footnotes at cursor position, per-page numbering, PDF export (via custom edits), DOCX export (appendix section). Remaining enhancements: replace native prompt with dialog UI, add edit/delete functionality.

title: Fix apartmentSqm not saved in ShumaDB.js
description:
## Bug Description
The `apartmentSqm` field (measured area from Garmushka) is NOT persisted when saving via ShumaDB.js.

## Impact
- User measures apartment using Garmushka in Step 4
- Value appears correctly in UI
- On page reload/session restore, the value is LOST
- Step 5 ValuationPanel also sets this field, also lost

## Root Cause
- `apartment_sqm` column EXISTS in database (ValuationService.js uses it)
- ShumaDB.js INSERT (line 523-542) does NOT include `apartment_sqm`
- ShumaDB.js UPDATE does NOT include `apartment_sqm`
- Wizard uses ShumaDB.saveShumaFromSession() which ignores this field

## Fix Required
Add `apartment_sqm` to ShumaDB.js:
1. Add to INSERT column list
2. Add to INSERT values
3. Add to UPDATE SET clause
4. Add to loadShumaForWizard() return mapping
close_reason: Fixed: Added apartment_sqm to ShumaDB.js INSERT, UPDATE, and loadShumaForWizard
